title: Former Barclays banker Roger Jenkins abandons dreams of cannabis ‘green rush’ after marijuana farm is sold
text:
Former Barclays banker Roger Jenkins has abandoned his dreams of joining the California “green rush” after the marijuana farm he invested in was sold.

A cannabis plantation backed by the 64-year-old multi-millionaire has been bought by to an unknown investor, City sources said.

Mr Jenkins, who lives near Malibu, invested in the venture in 2016, just as it was made legal for California voters aged over 21 to grow, possess and use limited quantities of cannabis.

He joined a wave of investors pouring cash into North America’s so-called green rush, a reference to the gold rush of the mid-19th century. They include libertarian Silicon Valley billionaire Peter Thiel, who gave Mark Zuckerberg his first...
description: Former Barclays banker Roger Jenkins has abandoned his dreams of joining the California “green rush” after the marijuana farm he invested in was sold.
